subject: Business
title: Equity Splits and Vesting
description: A fast breakdown of Equity Splits and Vesting for builders.

hook.text: Two co-founders split equity 50/50 on day one. One quits at month six. Half the company walks out.

buildup.text: Vesting releases equity over time â€” typically four years with a one-year cliff.

discovery.text: The cliff means leaving before year one gets you nothing. It prevents free-riding.

twist.text: Equal splits feel fair but ignore reality. Contributions are never truly equal over four years.

climax.text: Y Combinator advises: split based on expected contribution and use standard four-year vesting.

punchline.text: Equity is earned over time, not gifted at the start.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of a vesting cliff?
options: To prevent someone from leaving early with a large equity stake
To delay all equity until the company goes public
To give founders more control over investors
